prioritized_implementation_phases.description: Crash prevention optimizations (prevents downtime at scale)
prioritized_implementation_phases.realistic_benefit: Prevents crashes at 500+ users, improves memory stability

optimizations.title: Implement Connection Limits Per User/IP
optimizations.current_issue: No visible connection limits per user/IP - potential unbounded growth
optimizations.proposed_fix: Add connection tracking by IP/user to limit concurrent connections (max 3 per IP, max 2 per user)
optimizations.original_qwen_estimate: $2,000 (cloud elastic - NOT APPLICABLE to OPTION B.1)

implementation_strategy.step_1: Add Map<userId, Set<sessionId>> to track connections per user
implementation_strategy.step_2: Add Map<ipAddress, Set<sessionId>> to track connections per IP
implementation_strategy.step_3: Check limits in connection handlers before accepting new connections
implementation_strategy.step_4: Return 429 (Too Many Connections) error if limits exceeded
implementation_strategy.step_5: Clean up Maps when connections close

validation_gates: User with 2 active connections cannot open 3rd connection
IP with 3 active connections cannot open 4th connection
Error message clearly indicates connection limit reached
Connection Maps properly cleaned on disconnect
optimizations.business_impact: Prevents unbounded connection growth ï¿½ prevents exponential cloud costs

optimizations.title: Optimize User Cache TTL
optimizations.current_issue: User cache TTL is 2 minutes (120s) but could be optimized based on usage patterns
optimizations.proposed_fix: Implement adaptive TTL based on user activity patterns (1-5 minutes depending on recency)

implementation_strategy.step_1: Add lastAccessTime field to userCache Map values
implementation_strategy.step_2: Track access frequency: users accessed in last 30s get 1min TTL, 30-60s get 2min TTL, >60s get 5min TTL
implementation_strategy.step_3: Modify cleanup logic to use adaptive TTL based on access patterns

validation_gates: Frequently accessed users (admin, operators) cached longer
Infrequently accessed users expired faster
Memory usage reduced by 20-30% compared to static TTL
No increase in database query rate for active users
optimizations.business_impact: Reduces memory usage ï¿½ reduces cloud infrastructure costs

optimizations.title: Event History Size Management
optimizations.current_issue: Event history per channel may accumulate unnecessarily
optimizations.proposed_fix: Implement time-based and count-based limits on event history with more aggressive cleanup

implementation_strategy.step_1: Add time-based limit: events older than 5 minutes auto-deleted
implementation_strategy.step_2: Add count-based limit: max 100 events per channel
implementation_strategy.step_3: Implement FIFO queue: oldest events deleted when limit reached
implementation_strategy.step_4: Run cleanup every 30 seconds instead of 2 minutes

validation_gates: Event history never exceeds 100 events per channel
Events older than 5 minutes automatically removed
Memory usage stable during long-running streams
No impact on client reconnection experience
optimizations.business_impact: Prevents memory bloat during long streaming sessions

prioritized_implementation_phases.realistic_benefit: Reduces SSE/WebSocket bandwidth on Bunny CDN at scale

optimizations.title: Connection Health Monitoring & Auto-cleanup
optimizations.current_issue: Current heartbeat interval is 30s with 60s timeout, could be optimized
optimizations.proposed_fix: Implement adaptive heartbeat based on connection usage patterns
optimizations.monthly_savings: $20 (Bunny CDN bandwidth: 200 users Ã— 100MB saved Ã— $0.01/GB)

implementation_strategy.step_1: Track connection activity: last event sent, last heartbeat response
implementation_strategy.step_2: Implement adaptive heartbeat: active connections 15s, idle 60s, stale 120s
implementation_strategy.step_3: Add connection quality metrics: latency, dropped heartbeats
implementation_strategy.step_4: Auto-close connections with 3+ consecutive missed heartbeats

validation_gates: Active connections receive faster heartbeats
Idle connections use slower heartbeats to save bandwidth
Dead connections auto-closed within 3 heartbeat cycles
No false positives (healthy connections incorrectly closed)
optimizations.business_impact: Faster detection of dead connections ï¿½ better resource utilization
optimizations.testing_requirements: Load testing required to tune heartbeat intervals

optimizations.title: Optimize SSE Message Batching
optimizations.current_issue: SSE messages are sent individually, could be batched during high load
optimizations.proposed_fix: Implement message batching when sending to multiple clients during high load periods

implementation_strategy.step_1: Add message buffer with 50ms window during high load (>100 active connections)
implementation_strategy.step_2: Batch similar events (e.g., multiple bet updates) into single SSE message
implementation_strategy.step_3: Send immediately if buffer reaches 10 messages or critical event detected
implementation_strategy.step_4: Disable batching during low load (<50 connections) for lower latency

validation_gates: Message batching activated only during high load
Latency increase < 100ms during batching
Critical events (stream start/stop) never batched
Client-side properly handles batched message format
optimizations.business_impact: Reduced bandwidth usage during peak load ï¿½ lower CDN costs
optimizations.testing_requirements: Spike load testing with 500+ concurrent users

optimizations.title: Database Connection Pool Monitoring Enhancement
optimizations.current_issue: Basic pool monitoring exists but could be more proactive
optimizations.proposed_fix: Add proactive connection management and better queue handling

implementation_strategy.step_1: Add connection pool metrics: active, idle, waiting, total
implementation_strategy.step_2: Implement queue monitoring: alert if wait time >500ms
implementation_strategy.step_3: Add automatic pool size adjustment based on load patterns
implementation_strategy.step_4: Implement connection health checks: test idle connections before use

validation_gates: Pool metrics available via /api/monitoring/database endpoint
Automatic alerts when pool exhaustion detected
Pool size adjusts based on load (min 5, max 20)
Stale connections properly recycled
optimizations.business_impact: Prevents database bottlenecks during traffic spikes
optimizations.testing_requirements: Soak testing with sustained high database load

implementation_strategy.step_2: Negotiate compression support during connection handshake
